Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2009 10:09PM Godsgal wrote: Hi Stephanie When I first found out that I had breast cancer in the early 90's, my breast was leaking and I had no intention of going to the doctor at all.. Then one day I was going to the bus stop on my way to work and as I crossed the sidewalk, a wells fargo truck struck me on my right side and I was forced to go to the hospital to get checked.. and my cancer was found.. This was 3 months after my DH had recovered from a breast cancer of his own...and if he and I stand face to face, our scars touch and are in the same place.   A year earlier, we both had gotten baptised and joined our church as a married couple..  I guess satan was really angry because we found the LORD... Or GOD was preparing my husband's understanding as it relates to breast cancer and me.. Either way, I'm still alive and doing well... my cancer seems to be slow growing and I pray that it stays that way.. So I guess early detection does have its benefits.. Hattie Bee Lee (Believe)
Posts.Title: Early Detection of Mets- Does it Matter? TripleNeg RobinWendy

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 12:11AM Godsgal wrote: Stephanie, I met him when I was 15 years old and we have been together every since..I am now 48.. Please don't think that it has been all peaches and cream because it has not.  But it was worth it.. GOD set me up with what I would need right now in my life way back then.. I have fallen so deeply in Love with the LORD that the very thought of him sometimes takes my breath away.   My life has been amazing thanks to GOD.  I feel that if it is not my time to go - no matter what weapon the enemy (satan) tries to use against me it will not prosper !!!  The LORD never said the weapon would not be formed..he did say it will not prosper ! ! I realized a long time ago that I was not in control of my life  and that I'm just along for the ride... So now, because of my son, I am now basically raising my grandson whoi s 6 years old.. His mother was deemed incapable of caring for kids... So maybe the blessing of the LORD rests in my grandson ?? only God knows... I will definitly pray that the love of your life finds you.. But I believe God has already found you ! Stay strong, be blessed my sister and always believe ! Hattie

Posts.Content: May 14, 2009 10:26AM Godsgal wrote: Jennifer, Before you leave your job please check to see if your conmpany has long and short term disability.. THe short term disability will at  least keep you with an income until SSDI kicks in(there is a 5 months waiting period before receiveing SSDI).. And if you have long term disability which kicks in once short term disability ends, it will  give you additional money in addition to your monthly SSDI check.   Good luck my sister, Hattie
